intro: Heptacyclum, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Boraginaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Asia, particularly China and the Himalayas. The plants typically have hairy, herbaceous stems and produce showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white.
